verses.verse: And it came to pass in those days<WH3117>, that the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH6908> their hosts<WH4264> together<WH6908> for warfare<WH6635>, to fight<WH3898> with Israel<WH3478>. And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, Know<WH3045> thou assuredly<WH3045>, that thou shalt go out<WH3318> with me in the host<WH4264>, thou and thy men<WH582>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Achish<WH397>, Therefore<WH3651> thou shalt know<WH3045> what thy servant<WH5650> will do<WH6213>. And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Therefore will I make<WH7760> thee keeper<WH8104> of my head<WH7218> for ever<WH3117>.

Now Samuel<WH8050> was dead<WH4191>, and all Israel<WH3478> had lamented<WH5594> him<WH6912>, and buried him in Ramah<WH7414>, even in his own city<WH5892>. And Saul<WH7586> had put away<WH5493> those that had familiar spirits<WH178>, and the wizards<WH3049>, out of the land<WH776>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> gathered themselves together<WH6908>, and came<WH935> and encamped<WH2583> in Shunem<WH7766>: and Saul<WH7586> gathered<WH6908> all Israel<WH3478> together<WH6908>, and they encamped<WH2583> in Gilboa<WH1533>.
And when Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>, he was afraid<WH3372>, and his heart<WH3820> trembled<WH2729> greatly<WH3966>.
And when Saul<WH7586> inquired<WH7592> of Jehovah<WH3068>, Jehovah<WH3068> answered<WH6030> him not<WH2472>, neither by dreams, nor by Urim<WH224>, nor by prophets<WH5030>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586> unto his servants<WH5650>, Seek<WH1245> me a woman<WH802> that hath<WH1172> a familiar spirit<WH178>, that I may go<WH3212> to her<WH1875>, and inquire of her<WH5650>. And his servants said<WH559> to him<WH802>, Behold, there is a woman that hath<WH1172> a familiar spirit<WH178> at En-dor<WH5874>.

And Saul<WH7586> disguised<WH2664> himself<WH3847>, and put on other<WH312> raiment<WH899>, and went<WH3212>, he and two<WH8147> men<WH582> with him<WH935>, and they came to the woman<WH802> by night<WH3915>: and he said<WH559>, Divine<WH7080> unto me<WH178>, I pray thee, by the familiar spirit, and bring me up<WH5927> whomsoever I shall name unto thee<WH559>.

And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Behold, thou knowest what Saul<WH7586> hath done<WH6213>, how he hath cut off<WH3772> those that have familiar spirits<WH178>, and the wizards<WH3049>, out of the land<WH776>: wherefore then layest thou a snare<WH5367> for my life<WH5315>, to cause me to die<WH4191>?
And Saul<WH7586> sware<WH7650> to her by Jehovah<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, there shall<WH518> no punishment<WH5771> happen<WH7136> to thee for this thing<WH1697>.
Then said<WH559> the woman<WH802>, Whom shall I bring up<WH5927> unto thee<WH559>? And he said, Bring me up<WH5927> Samuel<WH8050>.

And when the woman<WH802> saw<WH7200> Samuel<WH8050>, she cried<WH2199> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>; and the woman<WH802> spake<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, saying<WH559>, Why hast thou deceived<WH7411> me<WH7586>? for thou art Saul.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto her<WH3372>, Be not afraid: for what seest<WH7200> thou<WH802>? And the woman said<WH559> unto Saul<WH7586>, I see<WH7200> a god<WH430> coming up<WH5927> out of the earth<WH776>.

And he said<WH559> unto her<WH8389>, What form is he of<WH559>? And she said, An old<WH2205> man<WH376> cometh up<WH5927>; and he is covered<WH5844> with a robe<WH4598>. And Saul<WH7586> perceived<WH3045> that it was Samuel<WH8050>, and he bowed<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776>, and did obeisance<WH7812>.

And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, Why hast thou disquieted<WH7264> me<WH5927>, to bring me up? And Saul<WH7586> answered<WH559>, I am sore<WH3966> distressed<WH6887>; for the Philistines<WH6430> make war<WH3898> against me<WH430>, and God is departed<WH5493> from me<WH6030>, and answereth me no more<WH3027>, neither by prophets<WH5030>, nor by dreams<WH2472>: therefore I have called<WH7121> thee<WH3045>, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do<WH6213>.
And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559>, Wherefore then dost thou ask<WH7592> of me<WH3068>, seeing Jehovah is departed<WH5493> from thee<WH6145>, and is become thine adversary?

And Jehovah<WH3068> hath done<WH6213> unto thee<WH1696>, as he spake by me<WH3027>: and Jehovah<WH3068> hath rent<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> out of thy hand<WH3027>, and given<WH5414> it to thy neighbor<WH7453>, even to David<WH1732>.

Because <WH834> thou obeyedst<WH8085> not the voice<WH6963> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and didst not execute<WH6213> his fierce<WH2740> wrath<WH639> upon Amalek<WH6002>, therefore hath Jehovah<WH3068> done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> unto thee this day<WH3117>.

Moreover Jehovah<WH3068> will deliver<WH5414> Israel<WH3478> also with thee into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>; and to-morrow<WH4279> shalt thou and thy sons<WH1121> be with me<WH3068>: Jehovah will deliver<WH5414> the host<WH4264> of Israel<WH3478> also into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>.

Then Saul<WH7586> fell<WH5307> straightway<WH4116> his full<WH4393> length<WH6967> upon the earth<WH776>, and was sore<WH3966> afraid<WH3372>, because of the words<WH1697> of Samuel<WH8050>: and there was no strength<WH3581> in him<WH398>; for he had eaten no bread<WH3899> all the day<WH3117>, nor all the night<WH3915>.

And the woman<WH802> came<WH935> unto Saul<WH7586>, and saw<WH7200> that he was sore<WH3966> troubled<WH926>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH8198>, Behold, thy handmaid hath hearkened<WH8085> unto thy voice<WH6963>, and I have put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in my hand<WH3709>, and have hearkened<WH8085> unto thy words<WH1697> which thou spakest unto me<WH1696>.

Now therefore<WH8085>, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice<WH6963> of thy handmaid<WH8198>, and let me set<WH7760> a morsel<WH6595> of bread<WH3899> before<WH6440> thee<WH398>; and eat, that thou mayest have strength<WH3581>, when thou goest<WH3212> on thy way<WH1870>.

But he refused<WH3985>, and said<WH559>, I will not eat<WH398>. But his servants<WH5650>, together with the woman<WH802>, constrained<WH6555> him<WH8085>; and he hearkened unto their voice<WH6963>. So he arose<WH6965> from the earth<WH776>, and sat<WH3427> upon the bed<WH4296>.

And the woman<WH802> had a fatted<WH4770> calf<WH5695> in the house<WH1004>; and she hasted<WH4116>, and killed<WH2076> it<WH3947>; and she took flour<WH7058>, and kneaded<WH3888> it<WH644>, and did bake unleavened bread thereof<WH4682>:
and she brought<WH5066> it before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586>, and before<WH6440> his servants<WH5650>; and they did eat<WH398>. Then they rose up<WH6965>, and went away<WH3212> that night<WH3915>.
